title: Subsequences with modulo
text:
You are given sequenceA1, A2, ... Anand integerk. For each integeri(0 ≤ i < k)find suchnonemptysubsequence ofAso that sum of numbers in this subsequence is maximal possible and remainder of integer division of this sum bykis equal toi.InputIn first line numbersnandk (1 ≤ n ≤ 106, 1 ≤ k ≤ 200).In second line:nnumbers representing sequenceA (1 ≤ Ai≤ 109).OutputPrintknumbers in one line.i'th number represent sum of numbers in subsequence for numberi - 1. If there is no such subsequence print -1.ExampleInput:6 5
2 8 10 44 15 32Output:65 111 77 103 109
